[[Kansas State Wildcats football|Kansas State Wildcats]] |- | '''Originated''' | 1917, named in 2009 |- | '''Series''' | Iowa State leads 49-42-4 |- | | '''Largest Victory''' | 1943
48-0 Iowa State |- | | '''Highest Scoring Game''' | 1983
49-27 Iowa State |- | '''Most Recent Game''' | 2011
30-23 Kansas State |- |} '''Farmageddon''' is the nickname for the American [[college football]] game played annually between [[Big 12 Conference]] rivals [[Iowa State Cyclones football|Iowa State Cyclones]] of [[Iowa State University]] and the [[Kansas State Wildcats football|Kansas State Wildcats]] of [[Kansas State University]]. {{Cite news | title = Going For Two | newspaper = The Kansas City Star | date = September 13, 2010 | urtate Universityl = http://www.kansascity.com/2010/09/13/2221663/big-12-could-help-dissect-frogs.html | accessdate = 2010-09-14}}{{Cite web | last = Ubben | first = David | title = Big 12 Blog: Key Stretch: Kansas State | publisher = ESPN.com | date = September 8, 2010 | url = http://espn.go.com/blog/big12/post/_/id/16727/key-stretch-kansas-state | accessdate = 2010-09-14}}{{Cite news | title = Cats Get Gritty Win in KC | newspaper = The Topeka Capital-Journal | date = September 19, 2010 | url = http://cjonline.com/sports/football/2010-09-18/cats_get_gritty_win_in_kc | accessdate = 2010-09-19}} The name makes reference to both the biblical battle of [[Armageddon]] and the agricultural roots of the universities (as both schools are their respective state's [[land-grant university]]). The name was popularized by the schools' fans in 2009, when the two schools began playing a series of neutral site games in [[Arrowhead Stadium]] in [[Kansas City, Missouri]]. In 2010, ''[[The Kansas City Star]]'' and other area newspapers adopted the name, and referred to the second in the series of games in Kansas City as "Farmageddon II." Despite the success of the Arrowhead Stadium series, the game will move back to Iowa State and Kansas State's campuses starting in 2011. The use of the name Farmageddon will continue and the game will be played as a fixed Big 12 rivalry on Thanksgiving weekend every year. Kansas State University won the first Farmageddon game in Kansas City by the score of 24-23, on October 3, 2009. Kansas State also won the second game in Kansas City, by a score of 27-20, on September 18, 2010, and won the third game in Manhattan, by a score of 30-23, on December 3, 2011. The two schools played a long series of games prior to the adoption of the nickname and have played every season since 1917. The series has been dominated by long winning streaks for both teams with each team's longest winning streak at 10 games. The all-time series stands in favor of Iowa State 49-41-4 after the [[2010 NCAA Division I FBS football season|2010]] game. ==Name== The name "Farmageddon" derives from a biblical reference to armageddon and both school's strong emphasis on agriculture within the scientific community and respected states. Both schools have a college of agriculture and an extension program that supplies new research to farmers in both Kansas and Iowa. The name has fan roots that can be attributed to the various message boards and media covering each team. ==Trophy== Currently no trophy has been adopted for the game, but fans have shown interest in the potential of starting a traveling trophy. The trophy would most likely be based on the agriculture roots of the schools, potentially a bronze tractor, ear of corn, plow, etc. Since the game will now be played on Thanksgiving weekend, many fans have supported the idea of a "Thanksgiving Tractor" as an idea for a possible trophy. The idea of a "Golden Acre" on each campus has also been discussed among fans with it planted to corn if Iowa State wins or wheat if Kansas State wins the game. ==Game results== ''Iowa State victories are shaded ââ red, Kansas State victories shaded in ââ purple, and tie games are unshaded.'' {| class="wikitable" !style="background: #e3e3e3;"|Date !style="background: #e3e3e3;"|Site !style="background: #e3e3e3;" colspan=2|Winning team !style="background: #e3e3e3;" colspan=2|Losing team !style="background: #e3e3e3;"|Series |-align=center style="color: #FFC61E;
